page.title: 02Cornwood church.
page.content: The tower,the oldest part of Cornwood Church,was begun in Norman times.It is dedicated to St.Michael and All Angels.Over the years it has been much altered, the most recent change being the removal of the wooden pews at the back of the church,leaving an open, carpeted space for exhibitions and the serving of refreshments, which gives it a warm and friendly atmosphere. Leading from the rear of the church a small room has been built, incorporating a toilet and kitchen facilities.The room has been built to blend in with the original stone work,and roofed with old slates,and lead guttering.The alterations caused a great deal of discussion among the villagers, many of whom were worried about the aesthetic effect.
